org.apache.ignite.streamer

Interface StreamerStage<IN>


  • public interface StreamerStage<IN>
    Streamer stage is a component that determines event processing flow. User logic related to any particular event processing is implemented by streamer stage. A stage takes events as an input and returns groups of events mapped to different stages as an output. Events for every returned stage will be passed to StreamerEventRouter which will determine on which node the stage should be executed.

    Generally, event stage execution graph if fully controlled by return values of this method, while node execution graph is controlled by StreamerEventRouter.route(StreamerContext, String, Object) method.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String name()
      Gets streamer stage name.
      Map<String,Collection<?>> run(StreamerContext ctx, Collection<IN> evts)
      Stage execution routine.

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name()
        Gets streamer stage name.
        Returns:
        Name of the stage.

      • run

        @Nullable
Map<String,Collection<?>> run(StreamerContext ctx,
                                     Collection<IN> evts)
                              throws IgniteException
        Stage execution routine. After the passed in events are processed, stage can emit another set of events to be processed. The returned events can be mapped to different stages. Events for every returned stage will be passed to StreamerEventRouter which will determine on which node the stage should be executed.

        Generally, event stage execution graph if fully controlled by return values of this method, while node execution graph is controlled by StreamerEventRouter.route(StreamerContext, String, Object) method.

        Parameters:
        ctx - Streamer context.
        evts - Input events.
        Returns:
        Map of stage name to collection of events.
        Throws:
        IgniteException - If failed.
